title: 'I have some gas left in the tank': At 37, Djokovic still has big tennis goals
description: Djokovic has had a rough start to 2025, but shown flashes of brilliance too. And he's aiming for that 100th tour win.
author: Simon Cambers

title: Draper eases into Monte Carlo Masters 3rd round
description: British men's No. 1 Jack Draper cruised into the third round of the Monte Carlo Masters with a consummate 6-1, 6-1 victory over Marcos Giron.
author: ESPN

title: Unlock the Perfect Slice Serve - Essential Tennis Podcast #415
description: The wide slice serve is a CRITICAL tool to have in your tool box. It pulls opponents out of position, opens the court up for you to hit into, exposes their usually weaker backhand side, and forces them to run twice as far for the next shot - if they even get it at all. Let‚Äôs take a deep dive into how YOU can develop this powerful weapon, step by step in this special episode of the Essential Tennis Podcast.
author: Essential Tennis LLC

title: 3 Djokovic Secrets To Winning More Matches - Essential Tennis Podcast #414
description: In this special episode of the Essential Tennis Podcast, you're going to learn the top 3 tactical secrets of Novak Djokovic that you can apply in your very next match. Use these tools to gain precision, consistency, and offense to make your opponents more uncomfortable, win more points, and win more matches.
author: Essential Tennis LLC

title: GB's Draper cruises into Monte Carlo third round
description: British number one Jack Draper makes an impressive start to his clay-court season with a commanding win over Marcos Giron at the Monte Carlo Masters.

title: 'I don't know if he'll enjoy it or suffer' - Rublev on icon and new coach Safin
description: Andrey Rublev hopes his coaching partnership with Marat Safin will last a long time - but it depends if his fellow Russian will "enjoy it or suffer".

title: #NextGenATP Fonseca, Tien among Estoril Challenger 175 entry list
description: Could Joao Fonseca earn two ATP Challenger Tour 175 titles in one season? The Brazilian teenager and fellow #NextGenATP star Learner Tien are among the players entered in the Millennium Estoril Open, an ATP Challenger Tour 175 event that runs from 27 April - 4 May. Introduced in 2023, the Challenger 175 category tournaments are held during the second week of select ATP Masters 1000 events. Fonseca won this season's first Challenger 175 event, the Arizona Tennis Classic in Phoenix.Players who exit early from Madrid could appear in Estoril, Portugal or in Aix-en-Provence, France, where World No. 27 Alexei Popyrin is the highest-ranked player entered.Ready for an explosive week in Estoril üí™üí•#ATPChallenger | @EstorilOpen pic.twitter.com/SyW7LMYRVE‚Äî ATP Challenger Tour (@ATPChallenger) April 8, 2025 While Fonseca and Tien are the teenage talents that are entered in Portugal, American Alex Michelsen spearheads the field as the No. 37 player in the PIF ATP Rankings, one of 10 Top 50 players entered across both events. Other Top 50 players on the Estoril list include home favourite Nuno Borges, Marcos Giron, Tomas Martin Etcheverry, Miomir Kecmanovic and Jan-Lennard Struff. Former No. 4 Kei Nishikori is also set to appear.The Aix-en-Provence entry list is highlighted by Popyrin, last year‚Äôs champion Alejandro Tabilo, Lorenzo Sonego and Luciano Darderi, who won his second tour-level title last week in Marrakech.We‚Äôre soooo ready for Aix-en-Provence ü§©#ATPChallenger | @OpenduPaysdAix pic.twitter.com/HHkq5KHAg3‚Äî ATP Challenger Tour (@ATPChallenger) April 8, 2025 [NEWSLETTER FORM]

title: Cerundolo to crash Alcaraz's clay-court opener? 'Maybe it will be third time lucky'
description: Carlos Alcaraz will need to be on his guard Wednesday. Playing his first clay-court match since last year‚Äôs Paris Olympics and aiming for his maiden victory at the Rolex Monte-Carlo Masters, the Spaniard faces Francisco Cerundolo in a tough opening match. The Argentine has been in top form this season, leading the ATP Tour with 17 match wins, according to the Infosys ATP Win/Loss Index. ‚ÄúI‚Äôve played him on grass, on hard and now it‚Äôs on clay, so maybe it will be third time lucky,‚Äù Cerundolo said, looking ahead to his match against the second seed. Cerundolo and Alcaraz met just weeks ago at the BNP Paribas Open in Indian Wells, where the Spaniard earned a 6-3, 7-6(4) quarter-final win in their second Lexus ATP Head2Head meeting. Alcaraz stormed back from 1-4 in the second set to fight off the three-time tour-level titlist and declared after the match, ‚ÄúToday was about surviving‚Äù. Alcaraz also defeated Cerundolo last year on grass at The Queen‚Äôs Club, home to an ATP 500 event. Last year‚Äôs Roland Garros champion will be playing his first clay-court match of the season and just the second of his career in Monte-Carlo. The 21-year-old lost his opening match in his 2022 appearance against Sebastian Korda. Meanwhile, Cerundolo has played half of his 24 matches this season on clay. En route to a final appearance at his home tournament in Buenos Aires, Cerundolo earned the highest-ranked win of his career when he upset World No. 2 Alexander Zverev in the quarter-finals. [ATP APP] On Monday in Monte-Carlo, Cerundolo looked right at home, racing past 2019 champion Fabio Fognini 6-0, 6-3. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs always special to play again on clay. I don‚Äôt know if it‚Äôs my surface, because I‚Äôve been doing really good on hard, but it‚Äôs the one I grew up on and played on all my life,‚Äù said Cerundolo. Cerundolo will return to Court Rainier III, aiming to stun Alcaraz just a day removed from top seed Zverev losing his opening match to Matteo Berrettini. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs going to be a tough match for sure,‚Äù Cerundolo said of facing Alcaraz. ‚ÄúHe can play amazing on any surface. Indian Wells, we played a really good match, tough conditions ‚Äî super windy, cold. We didn‚Äôt play amazing, but it was a tough match.‚Äù [NEWSLETTER FORM]

title: Monte-Carlo Masters 2025 Day 3 Recap
description: Day 3 at the Monte-Carlo Country Club brought a whirlwind of action as the Rolex Monte-Carlo Masters Round of 64 concluded and the Round of 32 began, delivering upsets, 48-shot rallies and gritty comebacks on the red clay. Matteo Berrettini stole the headlines, ousting top seed Alexander Zverev in a 2-6, 6-3, 7-5 epic, while ‚Ä¶
author: Jonathan

title: Monte-Carlo Masters 2025 Day 1 & 2 Recap
description: Action is underway at the Monte Carlo Country Club. Three singles matches were played on Sunday in and amongst the final qualifying matches before the main draw kicked off fully on Monday. Two seeds suffered losses during a cold start to the week at the Principality. Ben Shelton and Felix Auger-Aliassime fell at the first ‚Ä¶
author: Jonathan
